key_data.title: Key data
key_data.description: Optional Private Key. If this is set, you can use this keypair for encryption.

title.title: Title
title.description: Shown as the Title in Flow pages.

designation.title: Designation
designation.description: Decides what this Flow is used for. For example, the Authentication flow is redirect to when an un-authenticated user visits authentik.

compatibility_mode.title: Compatibility mode
compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: Required level of authentication and authorization to access a flow.

evaluate_on_plan.title: Evaluate on plan
evaluate_on_plan.description: Evaluate policies during the Flow planning process.

re_evaluate_policies.title: Re evaluate policies
re_evaluate_policies.description: Evaluate policies when the Stage is presented to the user.

invalid_response_action.title: Invalid response action
invalid_response_action.description: Configure how the flow executor should handle an invalid response to a challenge. RETRY returns the error message and a similar challenge to the executor. RESTART restarts the flow from the beginning, and RESTART_WITH_CONTEXT restarts the flow while keeping the current context.

local.title: Local
local.description: If enabled, use the local connection. Required Docker socket/Kubernetes Integration

url.title: Url
url.description: Can be in the format of 'unix://<path>' when connecting to a local docker daemon, or 'https://<hostname>:2376' when connecting to a remote system.

tls_verification.title: Tls verification
tls_verification.description: CA which the endpoint's Certificate is verified against. Can be left empty for no validation.

tls_authentication.title: Tls authentication
tls_authentication.description: Certificate/Key used for authentication. Can be left empty for no authentication.

local.title: Local
local.description: If enabled, use the local connection. Required Docker socket/Kubernetes Integration

kubeconfig.title: Kubeconfig
kubeconfig.description: Paste your kubeconfig here. authentik will automatically use the currently selected context.

verify_ssl.title: Verify ssl
verify_ssl.description: Verify SSL Certificates of the Kubernetes API endpoint

service_connection.title: Service connection
service_connection.description: Select Service-Connection authentik should use to manage this outpost. Leave empty if authentik should not handle the deployment.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

execution_logging.title: Execution logging
execution_logging.description: When this option is enabled, all executions of this policy will be logged. By default, only execution errors are logged.

execution_logging.title: Execution logging
execution_logging.description: When this option is enabled, all executions of this policy will be logged. By default, only execution errors are logged.

action.title: Action
action.description: Match created events with this action type. When left empty, all action types will be matched.

client_ip.title: Client ip
client_ip.description: Matches Event's Client IP (strict matching, for network matching use an Expression Policy)

app.title: App
app.description: Match events created by selected application. When left empty, all applications are matched.

model.title: Model
model.description: Match events created by selected model. When left empty, all models are matched. When an app is selected, all the application's models are matched.

execution_logging.title: Execution logging
execution_logging.description: When this option is enabled, all executions of this policy will be logged. By default, only execution errors are logged.

execution_logging.title: Execution logging
execution_logging.description: When this option is enabled, all executions of this policy will be logged. By default, only execution errors are logged.

execution_logging.title: Execution logging
execution_logging.description: When this option is enabled, all executions of this policy will be logged. By default, only execution errors are logged.

execution_logging.title: Execution logging
execution_logging.description: When this option is enabled, all executions of this policy will be logged. By default, only execution errors are logged.

password_field.title: Password field
password_field.description: Field key to check, field keys defined in Prompt stages are available.

hibp_allowed_count.title: Hibp allowed count
hibp_allowed_count.description: How many times the password hash is allowed to be on haveibeenpwned

zxcvbn_score_threshold.title: Zxcvbn score threshold
zxcvbn_score_threshold.description: If the zxcvbn score is equal or less than this value, the policy will fail.

execution_logging.title: Execution logging
execution_logging.description: When this option is enabled, all executions of this policy will be logged. By default, only execution errors are logged.

negate.title: Negate
negate.description: Negates the outcome of the policy. Messages are unaffected.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Timeout after which Policy execution is terminated.

failure_result.title: Failure result
failure_result.description: Result if the Policy execution fails.

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow used for authentication when the associated application is accessed by an un-authenticated user.

authorization_flow.title: Authorization flow
authorization_flow.description: Flow used when authorizing this provider.

invalidation_flow.title: Invalidation flow
invalidation_flow.description: Flow used ending the session from a provider.

base_dn.title: Base dn
base_dn.description: DN under which objects are accessible.

uid_start_number.title: Uid start number
uid_start_number.description: The start for uidNumbers, this number is added to the user.pk to make sure that the numbers aren't too low for POSIX users. Default is 2000 to ensure that we don't collide with local users uidNumber

gid_start_number.title: Gid start number
gid_start_number.description: The start for gidNumbers, this number is added to a number generated from the group.pk to make sure that the numbers aren't too low for POSIX groups. Default is 4000 to ensure that we don't collide with local groups or users primary groups gidNumber

mfa_support.title: MFA Support
mfa_support.description: When enabled, code-based multi-factor authentication can be used by appending a semicolon and the TOTP code to the password. This should only be enabled if all users that will bind to this provider have a TOTP device configured, as otherwise a password may incorrectly be rejected if it contains a semicolon.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

scope_name.title: Scope name
scope_name.description: Scope name requested by the client

description.title: Description
description.description: Description shown to the user when consenting. If left empty, the user won't be informed.

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow used for authentication when the associated application is accessed by an un-authenticated user.

authorization_flow.title: Authorization flow
authorization_flow.description: Flow used when authorizing this provider.

invalidation_flow.title: Invalidation flow
invalidation_flow.description: Flow used ending the session from a provider.

client_type.title: Client Type
client_type.description: Confidential clients are capable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials. Public clients are incapable

access_code_validity.title: Access code validity
access_code_validity.description: Access codes not valid on or after current time + this value (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

access_token_validity.title: Access token validity
access_token_validity.description: Tokens not valid on or after current time + this value (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

refresh_token_validity.title: Refresh token validity
refresh_token_validity.description: Tokens not valid on or after current time + this value (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

include_claims_in_id_token.title: Include claims in id_token
include_claims_in_id_token.description: Include User claims from scopes in the id_token, for applications that don't access the userinfo endpoint.

signing_key.title: Signing Key
signing_key.description: Key used to sign the tokens.

encryption_key.title: Encryption Key
encryption_key.description: Key used to encrypt the tokens. When set, tokens will be encrypted and returned as JWEs.

sub_mode.title: Sub mode
sub_mode.description: Configure what data should be used as unique User Identifier. For most cases, the default should be fine.

issuer_mode.title: Issuer mode
issuer_mode.description: Configure how the issuer field of the ID Token should be filled.

items.title: Any JWT signed by the JWK of the selected source can be used to authenticate.

jwt_federation_sources.title: Any JWT signed by the JWK of the selected source can be used to authenticate.

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow used for authentication when the associated application is accessed by an un-authenticated user.

authorization_flow.title: Authorization flow
authorization_flow.description: Flow used when authorizing this provider.

invalidation_flow.title: Invalidation flow
invalidation_flow.description: Flow used ending the session from a provider.

internal_host_ssl_validation.title: Internal host SSL Validation
internal_host_ssl_validation.description: Validate SSL Certificates of upstream servers

skip_path_regex.title: Skip path regex
skip_path_regex.description: Regular expressions for which authentication is not required. Each new line is interpreted as a new Regular Expression.

basic_auth_enabled.title: Set HTTP-Basic Authentication
basic_auth_enabled.description: Set a custom HTTP-Basic Authentication header based on values from authentik.

basic_auth_password_attribute.title: HTTP-Basic Password Key
basic_auth_password_attribute.description: User/Group Attribute used for the password part of the HTTP-Basic Header.

basic_auth_user_attribute.title: HTTP-Basic Username Key
basic_auth_user_attribute.description: User/Group Attribute used for the user part of the HTTP-Basic Header. If not set, the user's Email address is used.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Enable support for forwardAuth in traefik and nginx auth_request. Exclusive with internal_host.

intercept_header_auth.title: Intercept header auth
intercept_header_auth.description: When enabled, this provider will intercept the authorization header and authenticate requests based on its value.

items.title: Any JWT signed by the JWK of the selected source can be used to authenticate.

jwt_federation_sources.title: Any JWT signed by the JWK of the selected source can be used to authenticate.

access_token_validity.title: Access token validity
access_token_validity.description: Tokens not valid on or after current time + this value (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

refresh_token_validity.title: Refresh token validity
refresh_token_validity.description: Tokens not valid on or after current time + this value (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow used for authentication when the associated application is accessed by an un-authenticated user.

authorization_flow.title: Authorization flow
authorization_flow.description: Flow used when authorizing this provider.

invalidation_flow.title: Invalidation flow
invalidation_flow.description: Flow used ending the session from a provider.

client_networks.title: Client networks
client_networks.description: List of CIDRs (comma-separated) that clients can connect from. A more specific CIDR will match before a looser one. Clients connecting from a non-specified CIDR will be dropped.

shared_secret.title: Shared secret
shared_secret.description: Shared secret between clients and server to hash packets.

mfa_support.title: MFA Support
mfa_support.description: When enabled, code-based multi-factor authentication can be used by appending a semicolon and the TOTP code to the password. This should only be enabled if all users that will bind to this provider have a TOTP device configured, as otherwise a password may incorrectly be rejected if it contains a semicolon.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow used for authentication when the associated application is accessed by an un-authenticated user.

authorization_flow.title: Authorization flow
authorization_flow.description: Flow used when authorizing this provider.

invalidation_flow.title: Invalidation flow
invalidation_flow.description: Flow used ending the session from a provider.

audience.title: Audience
audience.description: Value of the audience restriction field of the assertion. When left empty, no audience restriction will be added.

assertion_valid_not_before.title: Assertion valid not before
assertion_valid_not_before.description: Assertion valid not before current time + this value (Format: hours=-1;minutes=-2;seconds=-3).

assertion_valid_not_on_or_after.title: Assertion valid not on or after
assertion_valid_not_on_or_after.description: Assertion not valid on or after current time + this value (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

session_valid_not_on_or_after.title: Session valid not on or after
session_valid_not_on_or_after.description: Session not valid on or after current time + this value (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

name_id_mapping.title: NameID Property Mapping
name_id_mapping.description: Configure how the NameID value will be created. When left empty, the NameIDPolicy of the incoming request will be considered

signing_kp.title: Signing Keypair
signing_kp.description: Keypair used to sign outgoing Responses going to the Service Provider.

verification_kp.title: Verification Certificate
verification_kp.description: When selected, incoming assertion's Signatures will be validated against this certificate. To allow unsigned Requests, leave on default.

encryption_kp.title: Encryption Keypair
encryption_kp.description: When selected, incoming assertions are encrypted by the IdP using the public key of the encryption keypair. The assertion is decrypted by the SP using the the private key.

sp_binding.title: Service Provider Binding
sp_binding.description: This determines how authentik sends the response back to the Service Provider.

default_relay_state.title: Default relay state
default_relay_state.description: Default relay_state value for IDP-initiated logins

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

items.description: Property mappings used for group creation/updating.

property_mappings_group.title: Property mappings group
property_mappings_group.description: Property mappings used for group creation/updating.

url.title: Url
url.description: Base URL to SCIM requests, usually ends in /v2

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: Internal source name, used in URLs.

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow to use when authenticating existing users.

enrollment_flow.title: Enrollment flow
enrollment_flow.description: Flow to use when enrolling new users.

user_matching_mode.title: User matching mode
user_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing user should be authenticated or a new user enrolled.

group_matching_mode.title: Group matching mode
group_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing group should be used or a new group created.

krb5_conf.title: Krb5 conf
krb5_conf.description: Custom krb5.conf to use. Uses the system one by default

sync_users.title: Sync users
sync_users.description: Sync users from Kerberos into authentik

sync_users_password.title: Sync users password
sync_users_password.description: When a user changes their password, sync it back to Kerberos

sync_principal.title: Sync principal
sync_principal.description: Principal to authenticate to kadmin for sync.

sync_password.title: Sync password
sync_password.description: Password to authenticate to kadmin for sync

sync_keytab.title: Sync keytab
sync_keytab.description: Keytab to authenticate to kadmin for sync. Must be base64-encoded or in the form TYPE:residual

sync_ccache.title: Sync ccache
sync_ccache.description: Credentials cache to authenticate to kadmin for sync. Must be in the form TYPE:residual

spnego_server_name.title: Spnego server name
spnego_server_name.description: Force the use of a specific server name for SPNEGO. Must be in the form HTTP@hostname

spnego_keytab.title: Spnego keytab
spnego_keytab.description: SPNEGO keytab base64-encoded or path to keytab in the form FILE:path

spnego_ccache.title: Spnego ccache
spnego_ccache.description: Credential cache to use for SPNEGO in form type:residual

password_login_update_internal_password.title: Password login update internal password
password_login_update_internal_password.description: If enabled, the authentik-stored password will be updated upon login with the Kerberos password backend

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: Internal source name, used in URLs.

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow to use when authenticating existing users.

enrollment_flow.title: Enrollment flow
enrollment_flow.description: Flow to use when enrolling new users.

user_matching_mode.title: User matching mode
user_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing user should be authenticated or a new user enrolled.

peer_certificate.title: Peer certificate
peer_certificate.description: Optionally verify the LDAP Server's Certificate against the CA Chain in this keypair.

client_certificate.title: Client certificate
client_certificate.description: Client certificate to authenticate against the LDAP Server's Certificate.

sni.title: Use Server URI for SNI verification

additional_user_dn.title: Addition User DN
additional_user_dn.description: Prepended to Base DN for User-queries.

additional_group_dn.title: Addition Group DN
additional_group_dn.description: Prepended to Base DN for Group-queries.

user_object_filter.title: User object filter
user_object_filter.description: Consider Objects matching this filter to be Users.

group_object_filter.title: Group object filter
group_object_filter.description: Consider Objects matching this filter to be Groups.

group_membership_field.title: Group membership field
group_membership_field.description: Field which contains members of a group.

object_uniqueness_field.title: Object uniqueness field
object_uniqueness_field.description: Field which contains a unique Identifier.

password_login_update_internal_password.title: Password login update internal password
password_login_update_internal_password.description: Update internal authentik password when login succeeds with LDAP

sync_users_password.title: Sync users password
sync_users_password.description: When a user changes their password, sync it back to LDAP. This can only be enabled on a single LDAP source.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

user_matching_mode.title: User matching mode
user_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing user should be authenticated or a new user enrolled.

group_matching_mode.title: Group matching mode
group_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing group should be used or a new group created.

request_token_url.title: Request Token URL
request_token_url.description: URL used to request the initial token. This URL is only required for OAuth 1.

authorization_url.title: Authorization URL
authorization_url.description: URL the user is redirect to to conest the flow.

access_token_url.title: Access Token URL
access_token_url.description: URL used by authentik to retrieve tokens.

profile_url.title: Profile URL
profile_url.description: URL used by authentik to get user information.

managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

enrollment_flow.description: Flow to use when enrolling new users.

user_matching_mode.title: User matching mode
user_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing user should be authenticated or a new user enrolled.

group_matching_mode.title: Group matching mode
group_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing group should be used or a new group created.

client_id.title: Client id
client_id.description: Client identifier used to talk to Plex.

allowed_servers.title: Allowed servers
allowed_servers.description: Which servers a user has to be a member of to be granted access. Empty list allows every server.

allow_friends.title: Allow friends
allow_friends.description: Allow friends to authenticate, even if you don't share a server.

plex_token.title: Plex token
plex_token.description: Plex token used to check friends

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

user_matching_mode.title: User matching mode
user_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing user should be authenticated or a new user enrolled.

group_matching_mode.title: Group matching mode
group_matching_mode.description: How the source determines if an existing group should be used or a new group created.

issuer.title: Issuer
issuer.description: Also known as Entity ID. Defaults the Metadata URL.

sso_url.title: SSO URL
sso_url.description: URL that the initial Login request is sent to.

slo_url.title: SLO URL
slo_url.description: Optional URL if your IDP supports Single-Logout.

allow_idp_initiated.title: Allow idp initiated
allow_idp_initiated.description: Allows authentication flows initiated by the IdP. This can be a security risk, as no validation of the request ID is done.

name_id_policy.title: Name id policy
name_id_policy.description: NameID Policy sent to the IdP. Can be unset, in which case no Policy is sent.

verification_kp.title: Verification Certificate
verification_kp.description: When selected, incoming assertion's Signatures will be validated against this certificate. To allow unsigned Requests, leave on default.

signing_kp.title: Signing Keypair
signing_kp.description: Keypair used to sign outgoing Responses going to the Identity Provider.

temporary_user_delete_after.title: Delete temporary users after
temporary_user_delete_after.description: Time offset when temporary users should be deleted. This only applies if your IDP uses the NameID Format 'transient', and the user doesn't log out manually. (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

encryption_kp.title: Encryption Keypair
encryption_kp.description: When selected, incoming assertions are encrypted by the IdP using the public key of the encryption keypair. The assertion is decrypted by the SP using the the private key.

managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

designation.description: Decides what this Flow is used for. For example, the Authentication flow is redirect to when an un-authenticated user visits authentik.

compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

configure_flow.title: Configure flow
configure_flow.description: Flow used by an authenticated user to configure this Stage. If empty, user will not be able to configure this stage.

verify_only.description: When enabled, the Phone number is only used during enrollment to verify the users authenticity. Only a hash of the phone number is saved to ensure it is not reused in the future.

mapping.title: Mapping
mapping.description: Optionally modify the payload being sent to custom providers.

denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

device_classes.title: Device classes
device_classes.description: Device classes which can be used to authenticate

items.description: Stages used to configure Authenticator when user doesn't have any compatible devices. After this configuration Stage passes, the user is not prompted again.

configuration_stages.title: Configuration stages
configuration_stages.description: Stages used to configure Authenticator when user doesn't have any compatible devices. After this configuration Stage passes, the user is not prompted again.

last_auth_threshold.title: Last auth threshold
last_auth_threshold.description: If any of the user's device has been used within this threshold, this stage will be skipped

webauthn_user_verification.title: Webauthn user verification
webauthn_user_verification.description: Enforce user verification for WebAuthn devices.

title.description: Shown as the Title in Flow pages.

designation.title: Designation
designation.description: Decides what this Flow is used for. For example, the Authentication flow is redirect to when an un-authenticated user visits authentik.

compatibility_mode.title: Compatibility mode
compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

configure_flow.title: Configure flow
configure_flow.description: Flow used by an authenticated user to configure this Stage. If empty, user will not be able to configure this stage.

public_key.title: Public key
public_key.description: Public key, acquired your captcha Provider.

private_key.title: Private key
private_key.description: Private key, acquired your captcha Provider.

error_on_invalid_score.title: Error on invalid score
error_on_invalid_score.description: When enabled and the received captcha score is outside of the given threshold, the stage will show an error message. When not enabled, the flow will continue, but the data from the captcha will be available in the context for policy decisions

consent_expire_in.title: Consent expires in
consent_expire_in.description: Offset after which consent expires. (Format: hours=1;minutes=2;seconds=3).

is_active.title: Active
is_active.description: Designates whether this user should be treated as active. Unselect this instead of deleting accounts.

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: Internal application name, used in URLs.

open_in_new_tab.title: Open in new tab
open_in_new_tab.description: Open launch URL in a new browser tab or window.

denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

use_global_settings.title: Use global settings
use_global_settings.description: When enabled, global Email connection settings will be used and connection settings below will be ignored.

token_expiry.title: Token expiry
token_expiry.description: Time in minutes the token sent is valid.

activate_user_on_success.title: Activate user on success
activate_user_on_success.description: Activate users upon completion of stage.

title.title: Title
title.description: Shown as the Title in Flow pages.

designation.title: Designation
designation.description: Decides what this Flow is used for. For example, the Authentication flow is redirect to when an un-authenticated user visits authentik.

compatibility_mode.title: Compatibility mode
compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

user_fields.title: User fields
user_fields.description: Fields of the user object to match against. (Hold shift to select multiple options)

password_stage.title: Password stage
password_stage.description: When set, shows a password field, instead of showing the password field as separate step.

captcha_stage.title: Captcha stage
captcha_stage.description: When set, adds functionality exactly like a Captcha stage, but baked into the Identification stage.

case_insensitive_matching.title: Case insensitive matching
case_insensitive_matching.description: When enabled, user fields are matched regardless of their casing.

show_matched_user.title: Show matched user
show_matched_user.description: When a valid username/email has been entered, and this option is enabled, the user's username and avatar will be shown. Otherwise, the text that the user entered will be shown

enrollment_flow.title: Enrollment flow
enrollment_flow.description: Optional enrollment flow, which is linked at the bottom of the page.

recovery_flow.title: Recovery flow
recovery_flow.description: Optional recovery flow, which is linked at the bottom of the page.

passwordless_flow.title: Passwordless flow
passwordless_flow.description: Optional passwordless flow, which is linked at the bottom of the page.

items.description: Specify which sources should be shown.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: Specify which sources should be shown.

pretend_user_exists.title: Pretend user exists
pretend_user_exists.description: When enabled, the stage will succeed and continue even when incorrect user info is entered.

title.title: Title
title.description: Shown as the Title in Flow pages.

designation.title: Designation
designation.description: Decides what this Flow is used for. For example, the Authentication flow is redirect to when an un-authenticated user visits authentik.

compatibility_mode.title: Compatibility mode
compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

continue_flow_without_invitation.title: Continue flow without invitation
continue_flow_without_invitation.description: If this flag is set, this Stage will jump to the next Stage when no Invitation is given. By default this Stage will cancel the Flow when no invitation is given.

single_use.title: Single use
single_use.description: When enabled, the invitation will be deleted after usage.

flow.title: Flow
flow.description: When set, only the configured flow can use this invitation.

title.title: Title
title.description: Shown as the Title in Flow pages.

designation.title: Designation
designation.description: Decides what this Flow is used for. For example, the Authentication flow is redirect to when an un-authenticated user visits authentik.

compatibility_mode.title: Compatibility mode
compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

backends.title: Backends
backends.description: Selection of backends to test the password against.

configure_flow.title: Configure flow
configure_flow.description: Flow used by an authenticated user to configure this Stage. If empty, user will not be able to configure this stage.

failed_attempts_before_cancel.title: Failed attempts before cancel
failed_attempts_before_cancel.description: How many attempts a user has before the flow is canceled. To lock the user out, use a reputation policy and a user_write stage.

allow_show_password.title: Allow show password
allow_show_password.description: When enabled, provides a 'show password' button with the password input field.

field_key.title: Field key
field_key.description: Name of the form field, also used to store the value

placeholder.title: Placeholder
placeholder.description: Optionally provide a short hint that describes the expected input value. When creating a fixed choice field, enable interpreting as expression and return a list to return multiple choices.

initial_value.title: Initial value
initial_value.description: Optionally pre-fill the input with an initial value. When creating a fixed choice field, enable interpreting as expression and return a list to return multiple default choices.

compatibility_mode.title: Compatibility mode
compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

session_duration.title: Session duration
session_duration.description: Determines how long a session lasts. Default of 0 means that the sessions lasts until the browser is closed. (Format: hours=-1;minutes=-2;seconds=-3)

terminate_other_sessions.title: Terminate other sessions
terminate_other_sessions.description: Terminate all other sessions of the user logging in.

remember_me_offset.title: Remember me offset
remember_me_offset.description: Offset the session will be extended by when the user picks the remember me option. Default of 0 means that the remember me option will not be shown. (Format: hours=-1;minutes=-2;seconds=-3)

network_binding.title: Network binding
network_binding.description: Bind sessions created by this stage to the configured network

geoip_binding.title: Geoip binding
geoip_binding.description: Bind sessions created by this stage to the configured GeoIP location

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

create_users_as_inactive.title: Create users as inactive
create_users_as_inactive.description: When set, newly created users are inactive and cannot login.

create_users_group.title: Create users group
create_users_group.description: Optionally add newly created users to this group.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Domain that activates this brand. Can be a superset, i.e. `a.b` for `aa.b` and `ba.b`

default_application.title: Default application
default_application.description: When set, external users will be redirected to this application after authenticating.

web_certificate.title: Web certificate
web_certificate.description: Web Certificate used by the authentik Core webserver.

is_superuser.title: Is superuser
is_superuser.description: Users added to this group will be superusers.

is_active.title: Active
is_active.description: Designates whether this user should be treated as active. Unselect this instead of deleting accounts.

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: Internal application name, used in URLs.

open_in_new_tab.title: Open in new tab
open_in_new_tab.description: Open launch URL in a new browser tab or window.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

items.description: Property mappings used for group creation/updating.

property_mappings_group.title: Property mappings group
property_mappings_group.description: Property mappings used for group creation/updating.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

items.description: Property mappings used for group creation/updating.

property_mappings_group.title: Property mappings group
property_mappings_group.description: Property mappings used for group creation/updating.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

authentication_flow.title: Authentication flow
authentication_flow.description: Flow used for authentication when the associated application is accessed by an un-authenticated user.

authorization_flow.title: Authorization flow
authorization_flow.description: Flow used when authorizing this provider.

connection_expiry.title: Connection expiry
connection_expiry.description: Determines how long a session lasts. Default of 0 means that the sessions lasts until the browser is closed. (Format: hours=-1;minutes=-2;seconds=-3)

delete_token_on_disconnect.title: Delete token on disconnect
delete_token_on_disconnect.description: When set to true, connection tokens will be deleted upon disconnect.

managed.title: Managed by authentik
managed.description: Objects that are managed by authentik. These objects are created and updated automatically. This flag only indicates that an object can be overwritten by migrations. You can still modify the objects via the API, but expect changes to be overwritten in a later update.

signing_key.title: Signing Key
signing_key.description: Key used to sign the SSF Events.

designation.description: Decides what this Flow is used for. For example, the Authentication flow is redirect to when an un-authenticated user visits authentik.

compatibility_mode.title: Compatibility mode
compatibility_mode.description: Enable compatibility mode, increases compatibility with password managers on mobile devices.

denied_action.title: Denied action
denied_action.description: Configure what should happen when a flow denies access to a user.

resume_timeout.title: Resume timeout
resume_timeout.description: Amount of time a user can take to return from the source to continue the flow (Format: hours=-1;minutes=-2;seconds=-3)

send_once.title: Send once
send_once.description: Only send notification once, for example when sending a webhook into a chat channel.

items.description: Select which transports should be used to notify the user. If none are selected, the notification will only be shown in the authentik UI.

transports.title: Transports
transports.description: Select which transports should be used to notify the user. If none are selected, the notification will only be shown in the authentik UI.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: Controls which severity level the created notifications will have.

group.title: Group
group.description: Define which group of users this notification should be sent and shown to. If left empty, Notification won't ben sent.
